intro: Syntherisma digitata, commonly known as the fingered syntherism, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Syntherismaceae and is characterized by its delicate, digitate (finger-like) leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white and pale pink, which bloom during the early spring. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Syntherisma digitata is considered a species of conservation concern.
